briefing.opening: Good morning, everyone. We will now begin the climate briefing for 2026-02-27.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Climate Crisis Warnings and Immediate Challenges
sections.content: Today's briefing begins with a warning about the severity of the climate crisis. In Europe, extreme heatwaves have surged tenfold, reported as the first instance where the impact of anthropogenic climate change has been quantified [7]. Domestically and internationally, the climate crisis is causing irregular flowering times for tropical plants and creating disruptions in food chains [9], while rising temperatures in Pakistan's valleys threaten traditional ways of life [107]. Furthermore, climate change is exacerbating socio-economic instability by being linked to soaring food prices [101], and research has also been published indicating that adolescents are experiencing emotional repercussions beyond mere eco-anxiety [99]. Amidst these circumstances, policy setbacks, such as the Trump administration's request to halt the adoption of climate change measures in the shipping sector and delay the introduction of a global carbon tax [2, 105], have also been observed, adding to concerns.

sections.title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· Domestic Efforts for Carbon Neutrality
sections.content: Amidst this crisis, diverse efforts are continuing domestically to transition towards a carbon-neutral society. Various local governments, including Incheon and Gimhae cities, are accelerating carbon neutrality practices in the public sector and encouraging citizen participation by hosting 'Carbon Neutrality Lifestyle Practice Competitions' [11, 19, 25, 32, 43, 50]. Notably, a system that awards carbon neutrality points for reducing vehicle mileage or purchasing products made from recycled materials is expanding nationwide in areas like Ulsan, Gwangju, and Sunchang, encouraging participation from citizens and businesses [14, 15, 16, 17, 20, 21, 23, 27, 29, 30, 31, 33, 38, 41, 42, 46, 47, 48, 49, 52]. The role of corporations is also being significantly highlighted, with Hyundai Steel beginning mass production of carbon-reducing steel plates and Hyundai Department Store's carbon neutrality efforts receiving government recognition [18, 26, 35]. Everyday practice examples, such as solar power generation in libraries and the operation of cafes without disposable items [10], are also drawing attention. Jeonbuk Self-Governing Province is advancing its carbon neutrality and green growth policies by joining ICLEI as a member city [37], and Pohang City is accelerating its carbon neutrality response through an interim review of its CBAM Integrated Support Center [53].

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Expansion of Renewable Energy and Technological Innovation
sections.content: The transition to renewable energy is establishing itself as a core driver in responding to the climate crisis. Korea Southern Power (KOSPO) is leading innovation in safety management by unveiling the first renewable energy facility inspection system combining AI and drones [54, 58, 63, 71, 76, 77, 79, 81, 83], and POSCO has established a steel project team for renewable energy to secure new growth engines [55, 82]. Furthermore, policy support is being strengthened, with the expansion of investment tax credits through amendments to the Restriction of Special Taxation Act and the 'Renewable Energy Self-Sufficient City Act' being promoted as a top legislative priority [56, 62, 72, 87]. Jeonbuk Self-Governing Province is seeking to leap forward as an energy hub by announcing plans for an additional 12 GW of renewable energy supply alongside the dissemination of zero-emission vehicles [51, 69, 74]. Hana Bank and Korea South-East Power (KOEN) are accelerating the construction of large-scale renewable energy infrastructure by signing an MOU for the development of the Wando Geumil Offshore Wind Power Complex [85, 86, 88, 90]. However, challenges such as concerns about the burden of the Ministry of Education's solar power policy on the ground [36], reports of a decrease in the net asset value of renewable energy infrastructure groups [61], Germany's abolition of mandatory renewable heating [65], and the imposition of temporary tariffs by the U.S. on Indian solar panels [92] are also being discussed.

sections.title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· Climate Change Adaptation and Ecosystem Preservation
sections.content: Adaptation efforts and ecosystem preservation to address the direct impacts of climate change are also actively underway. Korea Water Resources Corporation (K-water) is enhancing its response system by hosting a 'Harmful Algae New Technology Forum' to address changes in harmful algal blooms due to climate change [1, 3, 4, 6], and is expanding international cooperation on water security with the UN to strengthen water and climate change resilience in the Asia-Pacific region [8]. The Korea Forest Service is striving for ecosystem preservation by formulating plans for the future of high-altitude conifers amidst the climate crisis [12]. In Jeju Gyorae Recreational Forest, an RE100 campsite has begun pilot operation, attempting an eco-friendly transition by replacing the campsite's energy with renewable sources [13, 91]. These efforts are considered essential steps to protect our society and nature from the direct threats of climate change.

sections.title: ğŸŒ International Climate Policy and Scientific Trends
sections.content: The international community is deepening its policy and scientific responses to climate change. California became the first U.S. state to mandate climate change reporting, enhancing transparency [93], and the U.S. Supreme Court is set to hear a climate change liability lawsuit from the Boulder area, which could be a significant turning point for climate-related legal disputes [95, 98]. In the scientific community, new research on Antarctic iron levels has raised claims that it could distort climate change predictions [94], and efforts to record and study the traces of climate change are ongoing, such as the creation of Antarctic ice caves to preserve melting glacier samples [110]. A report that the Nunatsiavummiut people of Labrador are losing traditional travel routes due to climate change [109] demonstrates the severe impact of climate change on specific communities. Meanwhile, knowledge development and sharing to promote climate adaptation through citizen participation are taking place in Europe [104], and solutions to climate change are being sought from various angles, including the publication of a book proposing new market-driven solutions [108].

briefing.closing: Today's briefing highlighted the severity of the climate crisis, along with various response efforts and innovations unfolding both domestically and internationally. Addressing the climate crisis is a common challenge for humanity, and sustained attention and cooperation are more crucial than ever. This concludes today's climate briefing.

articles.description: Ice Memory Foundationâ€™s specially dug â€˜sanctuaryâ€™ offers storage for cores, which hold thousands of years of historyLast month the Ice Memory Foundation opened the first ever sanctuary for mountain ice cores in Antarctica, where samples will be stored for centuries to come.The cores, typically 10cm in diameter and a metre or more long, are stored in a specially excavated ice cave. The first to be laid down came from two Alpine glaciers that are rapidly shrinking. Continue reading...

summary.phenomenon: Last month, the Ice Memory Foundation opened the first sanctuary for mountain ice cores in Antarctica. The first cores to be stored in this sanctuary were collected from two rapidly shrinking Alpine glaciers.
